required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Follow-up of Elderly Patients Undergoing Instrumented Lumbar Arthrodesis Supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System(TM)
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Follow-up of Elderly Patients Undergoing Instrumented Lumbar Arthrodesis Supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System(TM)

brief_summary.textblock: Establish a data repository of patients who have undergone single, two-, or three-level lumbar instrumented arthrodesis procedures supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System.

detailed_description.textblock:
To collect and organize data into a repository from the Principal Investigator's and other Site Investigators' elderly patients (aged ≥ 60 years) who are undergoing single, two-level, or three-level lumbar instrumented arthrodesis procedures supplemented by the Implanet Jazz SystemTM at participating centers. This device is designed to provide a stable interface between spinal constructs and the rods; it can be secured around vertebral structures (such as the lamina, transverse or spinous processes) from T1 to L5 and is intended to provide temporary stabilization as a bone anchor during the development of a solid body fusion.
Clinical data will be collected as indicated at 6 weeks, as well as 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48, and 60 months post-operatively in the database.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who have undergone lumbar instrumented arthrodesis procedures supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System

intervention.description: The Implanet Jazz™ System is a polyester (polyethylene-terephthalate)-based braid designed to provide a stable interface between spinal constructs and the rods used in spinal arthrodesis procedures. The device can be secured around vertebral structures (such as the lamina, transverse or spinous processes) from T1 to L5 and is intended to provide temporary stabilization as a bone anchor during the development of a solid bony fusion.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are candidates for single, two- or three-level spinal arthrodesis surgery supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are candidates for single, two- or three-level spinal arthrodesis surgery supplemented by the Implanet Jazz System
- Patients at least 60 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under the age of 60 years old are excluded.

overall_official.affiliation: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center

facility.name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
